title: Brace vs Parenthesis mismatch error message could be more helpful

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```
enum Test {
    Val1 { val: u32 },
}

fn main() {
    let test = Test::Val1{val: 3};
    match test {
        Test::Val1(val) => println!("{}", val),
    }
}
```

This gives the following error
```
Compiling playground v0.0.1 (file:///playground)
error[E0532]: expected tuple struct/variant, found struct variant `Test::Val1`
 --> src/main.rs:8:9
  |
8 |         Test::Val1(val) => println!("{}", val),
  |         ^^^^^^^^^^ did you mean `Test::Val1 { /* fields */ }`?

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0532`.
error: Could not compile `playground`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

This was confusing for a bit as my enum had a variety of tuple vs struct enums (parenthesis vs brace) and it was very confusing for a few minutes on why it was saying I was wrong, yet telling me to put in what seemed like the same value I had in.  Fonts can make it hard to notice the difference that the suggestion is using braces and my code is using parenthesis.

It would be awesome if the suggestion could detect this difference and suggest the correct notation.
